author: bridge-bot
content:
<adietrichs> reminder: fee markets breakout call in 6 hours!

(re @adietrichs: As discussed, the breakout call this week will be on L2 fee markets! this one will be a bit more experimental, as this is more of a research topic - we will have to see to what extent a breakout call is a good format for making progress on this.

You can find the announcement & agenda here: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/rollcall-breakout-2-fee-markets/18381

As usual, zoom link will be shared here shortly before the call. Looking forward to seeing (some of) you on the call!)

author: bridge-bot
content: <Highlander1969> EEA - OASIS Community Projects L2 Transaction Fee Specification draft https://github.com/eea-oasis/L2/blob/main/workitems%2Fl2-transaction-fees%2Fl2-transaction-fees-v1.0-psd01.md

author: bridge-bot
content: <Highlander1969> While not defining transaction interfaces it does define fee components requirements for display, developers etc.

author: bridge-bot
content: <Highlander1969> It can be the foundation for a more technical standard on pricing

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> yes! I just have to figure out how üôÇ (re @ethrnd_rollcall_bot: <victoria.t> [reply]: will a recording be posted? üëÄ)

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> youtube processing being slow, it will take about 2 hours

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> is there a TL;DR üò¨? (re @CarlBeek: ok, it's up: https://youtu.be/URa8Jn-0aU4)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<adietrichs> basically, we talked about 3 main topics:
- repricing EVM operations (say keccak for zk)
- L1 passthrough fees, how to pay for settlement and DA cost
- potential proper multidim pricing (passthrough is basically a simple 2d version of that)

takeaway was that the topic where we might be close to having something to standardize is the L1 settlement cost. we talked a bit about what to standardize there, and the main feedback was that standardizing both a 2d tx type and a fee estimation API would be the best candidates.
So we introduce the concept of "settlement gas" (name tbd), and each L2 can have their own logic for how much settlement gas a tx consumes, and how to set the price for that gas during inclusion, but there would be a standardized way for users to specify limit and max price, and for estimating cost of a tx.
So ideally we can turn this into one or two concrete RIPs and move forward with that.

author: spacemonkeyforta
content: <@691283857206542386> How do we get an RIP number assigned to our proposal? It looks like posts on Eth Magicians with an EIP/ERC/RIP # have much more engagement than those without.

author: ulerdogan
content: After opening a PR, EIP Editors assign a number. You can change the topic name in Magicians when you have a number.
